does dsl workflow and coding workflow type are the same model in temporal system ? dsl workflow type seems like just a additional layer of converting dsl.
by the way, how to support lambda function ?

thank

Any dsl has an extra translation step from its markup to some object model representation that defines execution instructions that have to be executed by a runtime (programming language). Depending on the dsl you create or intend to use, as well as it's capabilities, you have to create a mapping to Temporal workflows/activities/etc constructs for the dsl to be executable. 


> by the way, how to support lambda function ?

Depends on the dsl really. If yours supports rest invocation, it would most likely translate into a Temporal activity that can invoke the 3rd party function via rest. Some dsls support standards like openapi, asyncapi, and/or grpc, in which case it would then translate into again an activity that knows how connect to the service given those definitions.
Temporal does not restrict you in any way here, as you define your activities as you wish.
